intro: Dianthus platyodon, commonly known as the flatseed campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its simple, clustered inflorescences of pink or white flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Dianthus platyodon is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
